sentences.en: But this is to begin literary culture at the wrong end.
sentences.cn: 但是,这恰恰将语文的修养过程本末倒置.

sentences.en: He tried putting teeth into milk, into water, and into cell - culture medium.
sentences.cn: 他尝试着把牙齿放入牛奶 、 水和细胞培养液中.

sentences.en: However, few people keep cell - culture medium handy at home or in school.
sentences.cn: 然而, 在家里或学校里很少人手边有细胞培养液.

sentences.en: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

sentences.en: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.cn: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.en: Minute fragments of shoot apices are proverbially difficult to culture.
sentences.cn: 微小的茎尖切段通常是难以培养的.

sentences.en: Paris is a good city for people who are interested in culture.
sentences.cn: 对于修养心性有兴趣的人来说,巴黎是个好城市.

sentences.en: Promote physical culture and build up the people's health.
sentences.cn: 发展体育运动,增强人民体质.

sentences.en: Silkworm culture is practised in order to get silk.
The age of the myogenic culture affects the ability to fuse.
sentences.cn: 生肌培养物的年龄影响融合能力.

sentences.en: The axenic culture of rusts has been achieved on various defined media.
sentences.cn: 在各种规定的培养基上可得到锈菌的单体纯净培养物.

sentences.en: The external surface of culture vessel is , of course, subject to contamination.
sentences.cn: 培养器皿的外面当然是被污染的.

sentences.en: The personality of Bill Gates determines the culture of Microsoft. "
sentences.cn: 比尔-盖茨的人格决定了微软的发展. ”

sentences.en: The resources of the tropics are not inadequate; they are culture - bound.
sentences.cn: 热带的资源并非不足; 而是受栽培的限制.

sentences.en: There is a pernicious culture of excellence: everything has to be not merely good but the best.
sentences.cn: 对于优秀存在着一种认识的误区：一切都务求最好。

sentences.en: This is a culture of cholera germs.
Tissue culture is the most important tool used in virus assay.
sentences.cn: 组织培养是用于病毒试验的最重要的手段.

sentences.en: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.cn: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

trans.tran_cn: 文化，文明，种植，养殖，培育培养物
trans.tran_en: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society
to grow  bacteria  or cells for medical or scientific use
